Advisory:
Kiwi TCMS 4.2:
- Enables testing with Badit, Coverity Scan, pyup.io, andf Snyk
- Uses SHA256 instead of MD5 and SHA1
- Uses the `secrets` module for activation keys
- Removes unnecessary AJAX view that had remote code execution vulnerability
- Doesn't use hardcoded temporary directories
- Upgrades to Patternfly 3.36.0, which fixes vulnerabilities https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:moment:20161019 and https://snyk.io/vuln/npm:moment:20170905
